Sentencas: Nanoparticles anchored on the perovskite surface have gained considerable attention for their wideranging applications in heterogeneous catalysis and energy conversion due to their robust and integrated structural configuration.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Herein, we employ controlled Co doping to effectively enhance the nanoparticle exsolution process in layered perovskite ferrites materials.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: CoFe alloy nanoparticles with ultra-highdensity are exsolved on the (PrBa) 0.95 (Fe 0.8 Co 0.1 Nb 0.1 ) 2 O 5+ d (PBFCN 0.1 ) surface under reducing atmosphere, providing significant amounts of reaction sites and good durability for hydrocarbon catalysis.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Under a reducing atmosphere, cobalt facilitates the reduction of iron cations within PBFCN 0.1 , leading to the formation of CoFe alloy nanoparticles.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: This formation is accompanied by a cation exchange process, wherein, with the increase in temperature, partial cobalt ions are substituted by iron.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Meanwhile, Co doping significantly enhance the electrical conductivity due to the stronger covalency of the Co -O bond compared with Fe -O bond.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: A single cell with the configuration of PBFCN 0.1 -Sm 0.2
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Ce 0.8 O 1.9 (SDC)|SDC| Ba 0.5 Sr 0.5 Co 0.8 Fe 0.2 O
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: 3- d (BSCF)-SDC achieves an extremely low polarization resistance of 0.0163 X cm 2 and a high peak power density of 740 mW cm -2 at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The cell also shows stable operation for 120 h in H 2 with a constant current density of 285 mA cm -2 .
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Furthermore, employing wet C 2 H 6 as fuel, the cell demonstrates remarkable performance, achieving peak power densities of 455 mW cm -2 at 800 degrees C and 320 mW cm -2 at 750 degrees C, marking improvements of 36% and 70% over the cell with (PrBa) 0.95 (Fe 0.9 Nb 0.1 ) 2 O 5+ d (PBFN)-SDC at these respective temperatures.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode

Sentencas: This discovery emphasizes how temperature influences alloy nanoparticles exsolution within doped layered perovskite ferrites materials, paving the way for the development of high -performance ceramic fuel cell anodes.
Titulo: Enhancing layered perovskite ferrites with ultra-high-density nanoparticles via cobalt doping for ceramic fuel cell anode
